title: Südstadion
text:
Südstadion is a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="stadium">stadium</a> in <a href="Cologne">Cologne</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a> with an 11,748 capacity including 1,863 covered seats.
History.
The stadium was built in 1978 and renovated in 2012, adding a new stand roof, new floodlights, new sounds system, sanitary installations and also ticket booths. After <a href="SC%20Fortuna%20K%C3%B6ln">SC Fortuna Köln</a> promotion to <a href="3.%20Liga">3. Liga</a>, in 2014 it was renovated again by adding a partition between home and away fans, new emergency doors, wavebreakers, a video surveillance system and improvement of the security services. A plan to further renovate the stadium was projected for 2015.
Other uses.
<a href="SC%20Fortuna%20K%C3%B6ln">SC Fortuna Köln</a> use this stadium for their home games. <a href="Cologne%20Falcons">Cologne Falcons</a> and <a href="1.%20FC%20K%C3%B6ln%20II">1. FC Köln II</a> also use it sometimes for their home games.
For the <a href="2021%20ELF%20season">inaugural season</a> of the new <a href="European%20League%20of%20Football">European League of Football</a> the <a href="Cologne%20Centurions%20%28ELF%29">Cologne Centurions (ELF)</a> plan to play their home games at the stadium.
